main.name: Kshitiz Sareen
main.description: Software Engineer | CS Graduate Student | Professor of CSC-210 at SFSU
main.bio: I'm a graduate student pursuing Computer Science at San Francisco State University. I have worked as a software engineer for over one year at Synoptek, mainly working with Microsoft Dynamics CRM. As a student with an outstanding GPA of 3.84, I am one of the few students selected to be a professor for Introduction To Programming at San Francisco State University. I am pursuing my research in data visualization, analytics, and machine learning.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.school: Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology
education.degree: Bachelors in Information and Communication Technology
education.description: Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description1: Streamlined job searches for 30+ healthcare institutions with a search system built using Next.js, ASP.NET and Elasticsearch.
work.description2: Collaborated with UX designers to refine the mobile app's user interface, leading to a 20% increase in user satisfaction utilizing React Native.
work.description3: Improved the hiring process by designing a communication module that handled over 300 messages daily using React Native, Apache Kafka, and Java.

work.title: Open-Source Developer
work.description1: Developed a CSV data browser, facilitating researchers in navigating vast datasets (10,000+ records) using C#, ASP.NET, TypeScript, Angular, and PostgreSQL
work.description2: Augmented API functionality by creating a file system manager and introducing 16 additional endpoints for enhanced data storage and management with C# and ASP.NET.
work.description3: Deployed over five visualization tools, empowering users to derive insights from extensive datasets through Angular and D3.js.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description1: Spearheaded developing and deploying enterprise applications for six clients using Power Platform and Dynamics 365 for case management and customer service portals.
work.description2: Boosted CRM efficiency by 60% through Power Platform and Dataverse/Dynamics 365, implementing business logic and solutions with custom code plug-ins, workflows, and HTML/CSS/JavaScript web resources.
work.description3: Used Azure Data Factory to migrate large datasets (1TB+) to SQL Server environments and processed them with Power BI.

work.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant, CSC 210 – Introduction to Programming
work.description1: Introduced programming concepts to a class of 50 students by teaching them the Java programming language.
work.description2: Increased class participation and passing rate by 30% by initiating mentorship programs for student development.
work.description3: Helped students practice programming by creating 10 weekly assignments, 3 class projects, 2 exams, and 5 quizzes.

work.title: Teaching Assistant, CSC 600 – Programming Paradigms
work.description1: Boosted grading efficiency by 80% by utilizing unit tests for assignments and exams using TypeScript and Lodash.
work.description2: Enhanced academic outcomes by generating performance analytics for over 50 students using Python.
work.description3: Saved over 20 faculty hours each semester by automating the grading process with Bash scripting.
